Description: A hollow terracotta figure of a recumbent hound modelled in the round, chewing on an unidentified object, lying on a low plinth roughly following its shape. A small hole is broken near the rear right leg. Two-piece mould. Micaceous orange marl clay with some white inclusions: possibly not an Egyptian fabric. White dressing overall. Black paint on right ear and tail, and in patches on the body. Red paint on the hound's mouth, and covering the plinth.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Bequeathed: Sir Robert Mond. Probably Hellenistic, second or first century BC. Bibliog: Edwards 1938-9: pl. xxiiib.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3766)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1991 8 Jan-24 Mar, Birmingham Museum and City Art Gallery, Man’s Best Friend
Acquisition name: Bequeathed by: Sir Robert Ludwig Mond
